Package stincmale.ratmex.meter

Class AbstractRateMeter<S,C extends RateMeterConfig>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stincmale.ratmex.meter.AbstractRateMeter<S,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - A type that represents statistics.
    C - A type of the configuration.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable<C>, RateMeter<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNavigableMapRateMeter, AbstractRingBufferRateMeter

    public abstract class AbstractRateMeter<S,C extends RateMeterConfig>
extends java.lang.Object
implements RateMeter<S>, Configurable<C>
    A generic implementation of a configurable RateMeter.

                            java.time.Duration samplesInterval,
                            C config)
        Parameters:
        startNanos - A starting point that is used to calculate elapsed time in nanoseconds (tNanos).
        samplesInterval - A size of the samples window. Must not be null, see RateMeter for valid values.
        config - An additional configuration. Must not be null.

      • getTimeSensitivity

        public final java.time.Duration getTimeSensitivity​()
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        A time sensitivity which affects the behaviour of RateMeter.tick(long, long) method in a way that allows registering a sample at an instant that differs from the specified one not more than by the time sensitivity.

        This behavior may be observed via RateMeter.rightSamplesWindowBoundary(). Hence this method can be considered as an important implementation detail leaked through RateMeter's leaky abstraction.

        Implementation considerations
        It is recommended to use a resolution (accuracy, granularity) of the timer used by a user of RateMeter. For example 200ns may be a good approximation of the System.nanoTime() accuracy (see timers-bench and Nanotrusting the Nanotime for measurements and explanations).

        Specified by:
        getTimeSensitivity in interface RateMeter<S>
        Returns:
        A positive, i.e. not negative and not zero time sensitivity which is used internally.

      • ticksTotalCount

        public final long ticksTotalCount​()
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        Calculates the total number of ticks since the start.
        Specified by:

      • rateAverage

        public final double rateAverage​(long tNanos,
                                java.time.Duration unit)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        This method is equivalent to RateMeter.rateAverage(long) but the result is measured in unit-1 instead of samplesInterval-1.
        Specified by:
        rateAverage in interface RateMeter<S>
        Parameters:
        tNanos - An effective (imaginary) right boundary of the samples window.
        unit - A time interval to use as a unit. Must not be zero or negative.
        Returns:
        Average rate of ticks measured in unit-1.

      • rate

        public final double rate​(long tNanos,
                         java.time.Duration unit)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeter
        This method is equivalent to RateMeter.rate(long) but the result is measured in unit-1 instead of samplesInterval-1.
        Specified by:
        rate in interface RateMeter<S>
        Parameters:
        tNanos - An effective (imaginary) right boundary of the samples window.
        unit - A time interval to use as a unit. Must not be zero or negative.
        Returns:
        Current rate of ticks measured in unit-1.

      • getTicksTotalCounter

        protected final TicksCounter getTicksTotalCounter​()
        Returns:
        A counter that must be used to register and calculate total ticks count. ticksTotalCount() returns getTicksTotalCounter().get().

      • getSamplesIntervalNanos

        protected final long getSamplesIntervalNanos​()
        Should be used instead of getSamplesInterval().toNanos() to avoid unnecessary calculations.
        Returns:
        getSamplesInterval() in nanoseconds.

      • getTimeSensitivityNanos

        protected final long getTimeSensitivityNanos​()
        Should be used instead of getTimeSensitivity().toNanos() to avoid unnecessary calculations.
        Returns:
        getTimeSensitivity() in nanoseconds.

      • checkArgument

        protected final void checkArgument​(long tNanos,
                                   java.lang.String safeParamName)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method should be used to check tNanos argument in methods such as RateMeter.rate(long), RateMeter.tick(long, long) etc.
        Parameters:
        tNanos - A checked argument.
        safeParamName - A parameter name that will be used as is without any checks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is invalid.

      • checkArgument

        protected final void checkArgument​(java.time.Duration unit,
                                   java.lang.String safeParamName)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method should be used to check unit argument in methods such as RateMeter.rate(Duration), etc.

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is invalid.

      • checkArguments

        protected final void checkArguments​(long tNanos,
                                    java.lang.String safeTNanosParamName,
                                    java.time.Duration unit,
                                    java.lang.String safeUnitParamName)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method should be used to check both tNanos and unit arguments in methods such as rate(long, Duration), etc. The method sequentially invokes methods checkArgument(long, String), checkArgument(Duration, String).
        Parameters:
        tNanos - A checked argument.
        safeTNanosParamName - A tNanos parameter name that will be used as is without any checks.
        unit - A checked argument.
        safeUnitParamName - A unit parameter name that will be used as is without any checks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either argument is invalid.
